text:
One might forget, among all of the Logo-tastic contributions of <@U69EQD0CD>, as well as the recent creation of the JuliaMono font (love it!), that they are also a wonderful, informative blogger!   I’d been busy with personal stuff (and election anxiety) for the past few months, and had somehow missed this one: <https://cormullion.github.io/pages/2020-10-09-asterisk/>.
Funny, witty, engaging read!

text: Thanks Scott. The cheque's in the post... :slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text: Thanks Scott. The cheque's in the post...

text: I already got my reward from you years ago, my cool (animated!!!) JuliaString logo! :nerd_face:

elements.text: I already got my reward from you years ago, my cool (animated!!!) JuliaString logo!

text:
Oh! I forgot to say, the blog was also incredibly informative, I learned a hell of a lot about the history of mathematical notation, and enjoyed myself doing so.
Are you a professor, <@U69EQD0CD> ? If so, I’d bet you are one of the students’ favorites :smile:

text: haha no, nothing to do with academia

elements.text: haha no, nothing to do with academia

text:
My parents, one of my sisters, a brother-in-law, a sister-in-law, some of my nephews, all professors.
I grew up surrounded by educators.
I feel very comfortable saying that you would make a wonderful teacher!
